EmailTemplate.name: RE: question on becoming active again at MBO (1354749537.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBO (1354749537.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - - Clean Clean false false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Dear David, Welcome back to MBO – its been along time I hope you are well! Please consider me your point of contact and follow the steps below to complete your re-enrollment. - Log in to the MBO site www.mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCVlBesV44xvOLI63NnDzUNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> - Click the “Enrollment” link once you are logged in - Confirm contact information - Print out I-9 at the end of the enrollment - You will sign/date section 1 and local notary will sign/date section 2 (most people visit their local bank.) Please email or fax back to MBO (we do not need an original copy.) If you use a US passport as supporting documentation I will need an image of it to comply with E-Verify (most people just take a picture with their phone and then email it to me.) - Send me your clients contact information (name, email, phone number) and I will reach out to get a contract in place. - The link to my private page can be found here <http://info.mbopartners.com/advisor-info-s-conde.html> there are lots of great resources on this page and I encourage you to bookmark it. Please contact me with any questions and also see comments below…. Take care,Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCVlBesV44xvOLI63NnDzUNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.mbopartners.com/?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCVlBesV44xvOLI63NnDzUNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCVlBesV44xvOLI63NnDzUNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: David Smith [mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com] Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2012 12:31 PM To: Sarah Buckley; Sara Conde Cc: me Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBO Hi Sarah and Sara
It's been a long time since last time we traded email. I am talking to a new client and had a couple questions for you.
1- What documents would I need to fill out in order to re-activate? New I-9 form, follow the re-enrollment steps above. 2- To have benefits through MBO do I have to bill a certain amount or work a certain number of hours per week or month? Yes, you need to bill around 80k a year. 3- Does MBO have any direct relationships with Rogers Communications in Toronto or a company they use, www.ProCom.ca <http://www.ProCom.ca> ? Not that I can see but that certainly doesn’t mean we couldn’t get one in place.
Please let me know
-DaveFrom: sbuckley@mbopartners.com <mailto:sbuckley@mbopartners.com> To: david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com> Date: Tue, 17 May 2011 09:01:12 -0400 Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBODavid,Thanks for the update! Good luck in your search and in the meantime don’t hesitate to let me know if you need anything! Best regards,Sarah Buckley MBO Partners Phone: 703-793-6037Fax: 703-793-6461 From: David Smith [mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com>] Sent: Saturday, May 14, 2011 4:41 AM To: Sarah Buckley Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBO Hi Sarah
Wanted to get back to you with an update. Gardenia did go ahead and sign the form for me the day you wrote me this email, but I'm holding onto it for now as the potential project I was contacted about has been postponed. I still intend to find another project soon but will wait until I have a good lead to go ahead and re-activate.
Thanks again for your help, it definitely makes the process much easier
-Dave
From: sbuckley@mbopartners.com <mailto:sbuckley@mbopartners.com> To: david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com> Date: Wed, 4 May 2011 16:37:24 -0400 Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBODavid,I spoke with Gardenia at the store below and she said she would be able to sign your I-9 form. She is there until 6:30pm today. 1321 South Winchester Boulevard, San Jose, CA (408) 429-8009 Thanks! Sarah Buckley MBO Partners Phone: 703-793-6037Fax: 703-793-6461 From: David Smith [mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com>] Sent: Wednesday, May 04, 2011 3:14 PM To: Sarah Buckley Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBO OK, thanks
so this SF person would do it for me? I'd like to try them as a backup.
For San Jose area I'd just try some of the Fedex Kinkos or UPS Store nearby zip code 95129
if you don't mind trying these UPS STores nearby me:
1321 South Winchester Boulevard, San Jose, CA (408) 429-8009
812 S Winchester Blvd # 130, San Jose, CA (408) 241-7674
1821 S Bascom Ave, Campbell, CA (408) 377-4345
I really apprecaite it. I know there is this other form which is the one they would notarize, i just haven't found a copy of it yet. If you have a copy could you please send me an email with that? It's a form they refer to in the I-9 and then they notarize that form
-Dave
From: sbuckley@mbopartners.com <mailto:sbuckley@mbopartners.com> To: david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com> Date: Wed, 4 May 2011 14:37:13 -0400 Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBODavid,Got your voicemail. The notary that we frequently use is in San Francisco, so I think that is a bit of a stretch. I have looked up some notaries in your area: http://www.notaryrotary.com/agent/searchdtlbody.asp?id=&PostalCD=LATLON&Address=95129&City=&l=&ll=&pfn=05133359001P&bfn=05133359001B&pmc=26&bmc=11&Miles=25&LocType=&StateCD=&PostalState=&PostalCounty=&EstimateCost=0&Lat=37.3052272&Lon=-121.9871217&Location=95129&Override=1 <http://www.notaryrotary.com/agent/searchdtlbody.asp?id=&PostalCD=LATLON&Address=95129&City=&l=&ll=&pfn=05133359001P&bfn=05133359001B&pmc=26&bmc=11&Miles=25&LocType=&StateCD=&PostalState=&PostalCounty=&EstimateCost=0&Lat=37.3052272&Lon=-121.9871217&Location=95129&Override=1> Can you take a look and possibly give me a couple that are near you, and what I will do is call them and explain the situation myself to see if they will be able to accommodate before you go to them. That way we can try and cut it down to one trip for you. Please let me know if you have any other questions in the meantime. Thanks, Sarah Buckley MBO Partners Phone: 703-793-6037Fax: 703-793-6461 From: David Smith [mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com>] Sent: Wednesday, May 04, 2011 2:01 PM To: Sarah Buckley Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBO just left you a message - please call me to discuss any updates also just curious why you sent me the expense policy - did it change recently? I would think whatever the client is willing to pay for we would invoice them for, correct? From: sbuckley@mbopartners.com <mailto:sbuckley@mbopartners.com> To: david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com> Date: Tue, 3 May 2011 14:09:37 -0400 Subject: RE: question on becoming active again at MBOHi David,It was great speaking with you today and thank you for your interest in MBO Partners again. I have re-attached some information just to refresh your memory on our expense policy. Here is some information regarding obtaining a Hong Kong work visa: http://hong-kong.travisa.com/VisaInstructions.aspx?CountryID=HK& <http://hong-kong.travisa.com/VisaInstructions.aspx?CountryID=HK&> I have re-enabled your enrollment, so you can now log in with your username and password and re-enroll. If you need me to send you your username or reset your password let me know. I have attached the updated I-9 and instructions for you as well. If you use a passport as your I-9 document, please send a photo copy of the passport photo back with your I-9. I am working on getting you a notary contact, so hold tight. If you have any questions as you go through your enrollment, please let me know! Best regards, Sarah Buckley MBO Partners Phone: 703-793-6037Fax: 703-793-6461 From: David Smith [mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com>] Sent: Monday, May 02, 2011 9:02 PM To: Amy Pikus Cc: me Subject: question on becoming active again at MBO Hi Amy
Last time we were in touch was October of 2009, at which time I had been looking for contracts but then the client forced me to go through one of their preferred contracting companies. At that time I had already filled out the I-9? paperwork for MBO Partners (the paperwork that required a notary which was difficult) but you'd said you'd keep it on file for the time being.
I have had a last-minute request to work on a contract basis for a local San Jose company but at their customer site overseas (Hong Kong). This would be for a few months starting asap. I wanted to see what would be involved in terms of:
1- being re-instated at MBO, hopefully without having to start over on the paperwork that had to be notarized 2- signing up for all the benefits 3- whether a Hong Kong work visa would need to be handled thorugh MBO (if I'm technically your W-2) or if that can be performed by the local company or their customer 4- how long to make everything happen to get contracts done etc. and set up
This is far from a deal I'm ready to sign on to, we've only just started talking about this opportunity today. Personally I hate being given no advance notice but now that I have a potential opportunity I just need to understand what it would take and if we have any potential roadblocks.
Please give me a call at your earliest convenience, 408-569-2910.
-Dave
